Title: npm security update: Classic token creation disabled and granular token changes
EnhancedContent:
Today marks another milestone in our ongoing effort to strengthen npmâ€™s security. As [previously announced](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/178140), weâ€™re implementing the first set of changes to npmâ€™s token management system.

## Whatâ€™s changing today (November 5, 2025)

### Classic tokens

- **New classic tokens can no longer be created** through the website, CLI, or API.
- Existing classic tokens continue to work until November 19, 2025.
- The `npm token create`
CLI command no longer generates classic tokens.

### Granular access tokens

- **New tokens with write permissions now enforce 2FA by default**.
- A new **Bypass 2FA** option is available for CI/CD workflows (unchecked by default).
- **All existing granular tokens with write permissions are now capped at 90-day maximum lifetime**.
- Existing tokens set to expire after February 3, 2026 have been adjusted to expire on that date.

## What you need to do

### If you use classic tokens

You have until **November 19, 2025** to migrate to granular access tokens. After this date, all classic tokens will be permanently revoked.

#### Migration steps:

1. Visit [npmjs.com/settings/~/tokens](https://www.npmjs.com/settings/~/tokens).
2. Click **Generate New Token** â†’ **Granular Access Token**.
3. Configure appropriate permissions for your use case.
4. For CI/CD workflows requiring write access, consider enabling **Bypass 2FA** or use established trust publishing with OIDC.
5. Replace classic tokens in your workflows with the new granular tokens.

**Note:** Granular tokens must currently be created through the website. Weâ€™re actively working on adding full CLI support for granular token management via `npm token` commands in the coming weeks.

### If you use granular tokens

- Check your tokensâ€™ expiration dates at [npmjs.com/settings/~/tokens](https://www.npmjs.com/settings/~/tokens).
- Plan for token rotation if any of them expire on February 3, 2026.
- New tokens created for CI/CD may need **Bypass 2F** enabled if noninteractive publishing is required.

## Looking ahead: November 19, 2025

On November 19, we will **permanently revoke all classic tokens** and replace long-lived local publishing tokens with 2-hour session tokens.
